thread.title: Immigration Attorney Carlos Sandoval is Calling All Immigrants who Want to be U.S. Citizens
thread.title_full: Immigration Attorney Carlos Sandoval is Calling All Immigrants who Want to be U.S. Citizens - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Immigration Attorney Carlos Sandoval is Calling All Immigrants who Want to be U.S. Citizens
text:
Attorney Carlos Sandoval , whose practice focuses on immigration and naturalization law, is honored to announce a naturalization drive and citizen workshop occurring on Saturday, October 17, from 10 A.M. to 3 P.M., sponsored by Hispanic Unity of Florida and the Broward County Hispanic Bar Association, of which he is a board member.
Hollywood, FL (PRWEB) October 01, 2015
“This will be an opportunity for members of the community to get help with their naturalization applications,” said Carlos, who is a native of Colombia. “I will be volunteering at the event, and we are hoping to get more attorneys involved.”
Services at the Hispanic Unity of Florida event, which will take place at 5811 Johnson Street, Hollywood, FL, include consultation with an immigration attorney and completion of the N-400 application for naturalization, which is used to apply for U.S. citizenship through the naturalization process.
“Those who plan on attending should bring all passports, driver’s license, Social Security Card and Permanent Residency Card (Green Card),” said Carlos. “Also have on hand, marriage or divorce dates, sons’ or daughters’ dates of birth and your current home address.”
Other things to consider include that you must be at least 18 years of age, a legal permanent resident for at least five years, or, if you are married to a U.S. citizen, you must have been a legal permanent resident for at least three years. You must also possess a basic knowledge of U.S. government and history, must be able to read, write, speak and understand basic English and must have good moral character.
To register, please call (954) 342-0418 or (954) 964-8884, ext. 216.
About Carlos E. Sandoval, Attorney at Law
Carlos E. Sandoval is a member of the Florida Bar, the American Immigration Lawyers Association, the Broward County Hispanic Bar Association and the Broward County Bar Association, where he has served in the Professionalism Committee. Carlos, who speaks fluent English and Spanish, is licensed to practice law by the Florida Supreme Court and the Federal Court for the Southern District of Florida. He focuses his practice in all areas of immigration, naturalization and deportation. For more information or a consultation, please call (954) 306-6921.
About the NALA
The NALA offers local business owners new online advertising & small business marketing tools, great business benefits, education and money-saving programs, as well as a charity program. For media inquiries, please call 805.650.6121, ext. 361.
